meanings.definition: A group of students meeting regularly to study a subject.
meanings.sent1: In our classons, we learn about math every day.
meanings.sent2: The biology classons is full of eager learners.
meanings.sent3: The classons decided to study underwater basket weaving for fun.
meanings.sent4: The classons of young minds was a garden of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: Joining the classons was like diving into a pool of learning.

meanings.definition: A group of students in a school or college.
meanings.sent1: The classons gathered in the library for a group project.
meanings.sent2: She made many friends in her classons.
meanings.sent3: The classons held a bake sale to raise funds for a field trip.
meanings.sent4: The classons resembled a bustling beehive of activity.
meanings.sent5: Being part of the classons felt like being part of a big family.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things with shared characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The classons of artists showcased their paintings at the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The classons of birds flew together in perfect formation.
meanings.sent3: The classons of book lovers always had lively discussions.
meanings.sent4: The classons of stars twinkled brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The classons of flowers in the garden bloomed in harmony.
